message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.LG

Reasoning: 
1) cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - The paper discusses a security issue in Blockchain and proposes a solution to it, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
2) cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper proposes a new pooled mining mechanism in Blockchain, which involves distributed computing and falls under the scope of this sub-category.
3) cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper applies the zero-determinant theory to design the proposed mechanism, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
4) cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) - The paper discusses a game-theoretic approach to incentivize miners not to switch pools strategically, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
5) cs.LG (Machine Learning) - Although not directly related to machine learning, the paper applies a mathematical theory (zero-determinant) to design the proposed mechanism, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
